drawer.newUserText: In order to contribute to a platform analysis on AnalogIST, you need to be a member of the dedicated Trello board.
drawer.becomeMemberSuccess: Your request will be processed as soon as possible.

ezLogger.title: ezPAARSE Logger
ezLogger.waitingForTraffic: Waiting for traffic, let's browse the Internet !
ezLogger.getTheExtension: Does nothing show up? Download the ezPAARSE Logger extension!
ezLogger.exportDesc: Click below to export the traffic you captured as a standard log file. This file can be processed with ezPAARSE without any additional configuration.
ezLogger.exportUseSearch: Please note that the search field is taken into account.
ezLogger.captureLimitReached: You reached the capture limit, the oldest requests will now be replaced by the new ones.

ezLoggerSettings.nationalInstanceDesc: The public instance is hosted on {ezpaarseURL} and always provides the latest version of ezPAARSE.
ezLoggerSettings.name: Name
ezLoggerSettings.patchHyphensDesc: If your proxy replaces dots with hyphens, check "patch hyphens" to duplicate lines (in order to generate all possible URLs).
ezLoggerSettings.defaultParserDesc: Unrecognized URLs will be analyzed by this parser. Allows for processing the logs of a specific platform without worrying about the proxy suffixes.
ezLoggerSettings.failedToFetchParsers: Failed to fetch the parser list
ezLoggerSettings.error_no_response: The ezPAARSE instance is not available

badges.noMetrics: So it is not possible to load the badges list!

home.whatIsEzPaarse: ezPAARSE now comes with a list of {parsers} parsers, which are the result of an analytical work provided by the community, and which provide users with a good coverage of their institution's subscriptions to electronic resources.
home.whatIsAnalogist: The community platform, called AnalogIST, is the place where different types of URLs are collected, semi-automatically analyzed and commented so that the corresponding parser can be accurate and complete. For publishers or providers who are not yet recognized by ezPAARSE, or that simply need an update, it is easy to contribute to a platform analysis: just open a Trello account and follow the guide!
home.goodAnalyses: Once the analysis is considered satisfactory, or complete, a programmer (usually from the ezPAARSE/ezMESURE team will take over and implement the corresponding parser. This parser will be added to the existing parsers in the dedicated github repository and can be retrieved by all instances of ezPAARSE, through a simple update mechanism embedded in the software administration area. This mode of operation ensures that each new parser, as well as each software and resource update, benefits all existing installations of ezPAARSE: work is required only in one place and only once.
